thread.title: Komets 2-0 after win in home opener
thread.title_full: Komets 2-0 after win in home opener

title: Komets 2-0 after win in home opener
text:
Komets 2-0 after win in home opener 
By Dean Pantazi - 21 Alive October 17, 2015 Updated Oct 17, 2015 at 11:47 PM EDT 
FORT WAYNE, Ind. (21 Alive) - Peter Sivak and Trevor Cheek tallied first period goals and Pat Nagle in goal made them stand up for a 3-1 win for the Komets over Kalamazoo in the K's home opener Saturday night. 
The Komet spotted the K-Wings a 1-0 lead before first tying and then going ahead on the scores by Sivak and Cheek, 
Shawn Szydlowski scored into an open net late for the final margin. 
The Komets next see action on Friday night against Indianapolis.
